column6: A Global Navigation Satellite System (GNSS) signal controlled clock, which receives a signal that comes from the atomic clock of a GNSS constellation of satellites.
A regular procedure of manual comparison with a reference clock
A radio controlled clock, which receives a radio signal that comes from a reference/atomic clock.

A server computer that reads the actual time from a reference/atomic clock and distributes this information to its clients using a computer network. The time server may be a local network time server or an internet time server.
